Key Match Events: The U.S. fell to 76-5 in their chase but a 91-run partnership between Andries Gous (80 unbeaten) and Harmeet Singh (38) had them threaten another upset of an established cricketing nation.
Kagiso Rabada — one of the world’s best bowlers — conceded just two runs and took the wicket of Harmeet in the 19th over to effectively end the co-hosts’ chances.
Pre-Game Insights: U.S. captain Aaron Jones, standing in for injured regular skipper Monank Patel, said he thought the team could have been more disciplined bowling-wise.
Post-Match Reflections: U.S. captain Aaron Jones said he was disappointed but not wanting to say disappointed, it’s hard to take the defeat after getting so close.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Super Eight phase sees eight teams compete for places in the last four.
The top two in each group will progress to the semifinals before the tournament’s final, in Bridgetown on June 29.
